introduction: This chapter covers the connection between software and computer architecture, specifically focusing on micro architecture. The course begins with zero and one and moves up to logic design before diving into software and computer architecture. Now, we will explore how to build a microprocessor by putting together hardware blocks that can run machine language instructions. Performance analysis is a key aspect, and we will look at three different micro architectures: single-cycle, multicycle, and pipeline processors. The chapter concludes with a discussion on advanced micro architecture techniques used in current processors.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Micro Architecture
content: Explanation of micro architecture as the hardware designer's view of the architecture.
Division of the processor into data path and controller.
Discussion of three different micro architectures: single-cycle, multicycle, and pipeline processors.
Explanation of the architectural state and its importance in micro architecture.

sections.title: Section 2: Performance Analysis
content: Definition of performance analysis and its importance in micro architecture.
Explanation of program execution time as the ultimate measure of performance.
Discussion of cycles per instruction (CPI) and clock period (TC) in performance analysis.
Introduction of instruction per cycle (IPC) as the reciprocal of CPI.

sections.title: Section 3: Single-Cycle Processor
content: Explanation of single-cycle processors and their key characteristic of having all work done in one clock cycle.
Discussion of the clock cycle length and its impact on performance.
Comparison of single-cycle processors with other micro architectures.
Explanation of how to measure the performance of single-cycle processors.

sections.title: Section 4: Multicycle Processor
content: Explanation of multicycle processors and their method of breaking up instructions into simpler steps.
Discussion of reusing hardware and its impact on performance.
Comparison of multicycle processors with other micro architectures.
Explanation of how to measure the performance of multicycle processors.

sections.title: Section 5: Pipeline Processor
content: Explanation of pipeline processors and their method of overlapping instruction execution.
Discussion of how pipeline processors improve performance compared to single-cycle and multicycle processors.
Comparison of pipeline processors with other micro architectures.
Explanation of how to measure the performance of pipeline processors.
